channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-15499] Add multiple data type support for increment
item.description: Currently the increment assumes long with byte-wise serialization. It's useful to support flexible data type/serializations.
item.summary: Add multiple data type support for increment

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.

comments.comment:
+public enum NumberCodecType {

This seems a relatively big addition.
Suggest sending notice to dev@hbase so that it gets adequate attention.

-1 overall

Why? Looks like non-controversial feature addition to me.
Patch looks good to me. I like your use of our existing type system complimenting it with NumberCodecType. +1 after fixing annotation complaint above.

I am +1 on this. Needs a release note. Nick Dimiduk The number type stuff is good by you?

Wiring our atomic ops for arbitrary user extension via the DataType interfaces has long been on my wish list. I'm stoked to see other interest here!

I'd really like to see this NumberCodecType participate in the DataType hierarchy. Maybe there's a sibling interface called "Incrementable"? But that way the types that increment supports remain pluggable. The Enum implementation here keeps everything locked in hbase, not user extensible.
He Liangliang What you think of Nick Dimiduk comment boss? Thanks.

Nick Dimiduk Do you suggest adding an extra interface like Incrementable (or Addable) to DataType hierarchy and passing type class name in the increment call? This approach is better if this is a common requirement.

That's the direction I'm thinking, yes. The difference is that this is a bigger project which hasn't been thoroughly thought through/designed (ie, which data types are supported, what operations in addition to increment are supported, &c). Perhaps it's better to go forward with your attached implementation and we can address the larger designed if/when they materialize.
Sounds good to me. Which branches to commit to He Liangliang?
Update patch. stack This patch is for trunk.
